CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 4, 1945, pg. 8, reads: "Mrs. Charles Page...a radiant bride..." Article partially reads: "The rectory of St. Anselm Catholic Church was the scene of the ceremony which united in holy matrimony Miss Mary Jane Mitchell Page, granddaughter of Mr. and Mrs. David Mitchell of Lloyd Avenue, Swissvale, and Sgt. Charles L. Page, son of Mrs. Mary W. Page of Harpers Ferry W. Va., last Thursday evening.  Father Dillon read the nuptial vows before a small group of relatives and close friends.  Given in marriage by her grandfather, Miss Mitchell chose a lovely afternoon creation of white pique adorned with rosettes for her bridal costume.  She wore a short veil of tulle, draped from a heart-shaped cap; white lace gloves and a corsage of American Beauty roses.  Her jewelry consisted of a pearl necklace and earrings and she carried a prayer book.  Miss Virginia Wise, in blue print with gardenia corsage, was maid of honor. Charles Cuthbert stood with the groom...The new Mrs. Page is a student in School of Business Administration at the University of Pittsburgh.  Her husband is a graduate of Morgan State College.  She is pledged to Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority and he is a brother of Alpha Phi Alpha."
TitMainTitle: Groom Charles L. Page wearing military uniform, and bride Mary Jane Mitchell wearing white pique dress with short sleeves, and fingerless lace gloves, standing on sloped hill, another version
